title: Anula Seya should not be placed under individual or temple incumbent control: Bellanwila Thera
byline: The renovation work of the historic Anula Seya in Mihintale Diggala has stalled, and it is inappropriate to hand it over to an individual or appoint a temple incumbent, Venerable Bellanwila Dhammarathana Thera said yesterday.

title: AI firm says its technology weaponised by hackers
byline: US artificial intelligence (AI) company Anthropic says its technology has been ’’weaponised’’ by hackers to carry out sophisticated cyber attacks.

title: Cases of flesh-eating screwworm on the rise in Mexico
byline: The number of animals infested with New World screwworm (NWS), a flesh-eating parasite, has risen by 53% in the four weeks to mid-August, Mexican government data reveals.

title: Chandimal, Avishka out of Sri Lanka Squad
byline: Batsmen Dinesh Chandimal and Avishka Fernando have been axed from the Sri Lanka T20 squad ahead of the three-match series against Zimbabwe which starts in Harare on September 3. Both Chandimal and Fernando were members of the Sri Lanka team that last played in a T20 home series that was against Bangladesh last month.

title: All former presidents under probe
byline: In the wake of the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe over the alleged misuse of state funds for a foreign trip, the government said it would probe similar malpractices involving other former Heads of State based on complaints, a Minister said.

title: Dr.  Nandalal Weerasinghe to deliver CBSL anniversary oration today
byline: Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe will deliver today the anniversary oration at the institution’s 75th anniversary celebrations, to be held at the Atrium of the institution.

title: CBSL Chief wins ‘A’ grade from Global Finance
byline: Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe has received an ‘A’ grade in Global Finance magazine’s Annual Central Banker Report Cards 2025, a recognition that comes as the Central Bank of Sri Lanka marks its 75th anniversary.

title: Rajitha Senaratne remanded till September 9
byline: Former Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senaratne was today ordered to be remanded until September 9 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama

title: Nimal Lanza arrested
byline: Former State Minister Nimal Lanza has been arrested by the Kochchikade police.

title: Rathana Thera appears before court
byline: Former MP Athuraliye Rathana Thera, who was evading arrest, appeared before the Gangodawila Magistrate’s Court this morning.

title: South Korea’s ex-first lady charged with corruption, bribery
byline: South Korea’s former first lady Kim Keon Hee and former Prime Minister Han Duck-soo were indicted Friday in special investigations that followed the ousting of the former president for imposing martial law.

title: Rajitha remanded
byline: The case filed against former Fisheries Minister Rajitha Senaratne, for allegedly influencing the Board of Directors of the Fisheries Corporation to lease out the Modara Fisheries Harbour to a private company at a low rate, was taken up today before the Colombo High Court.

title: Writ petition on elephant protection: Court directs notices to authorities
byline: The Court of Appeal today directed that direct notices be served on the Minister of Environment, the Director General of the Department of Wildlife Conservation and other state authorities in connection with a writ petition filed seeking an order directing the authorities to detect and remove illegal electric fences to ensure the protection and conservation of elephants.

title: Electric boats to collect waste on Beira Lake
byline: Steps have been taken to introduce electric boats to collect waste on the Beira Lake, which can collect up to 3,000 kgs of floating solid waste every day, Western Province Governor Hanif Yusoof said.

title: Handcuffed suspect jumps into crocodile pit in escape bid at Millaniya
byline: Millaniya Police arrested a suspect linked to a shop burglary, who then attempted a dramatic escape by leaping into a crocodile-infested pit while still in handcuffs.

title: Rajitha Senaratne appears before Colombo High Court
byline: Former Minister Rajitha Senaratne, who had been evading arrest for several days, appeared before the Colombo High Court today.

title: All former Presidents under probe for possible malpractices during office
byline: In the wake of the arrest of former President Ranil Wickremesinghe over the alleged misuse of state funds for a foreign trip, the government said it would probe similar malpractices involving other former Heads of State based on complaints, a Minister said.

title: Dr.  Nandalal Weerasinghe to deliver CBSL anniversary oration today
byline: Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Governor Nandalal Weerasinghe will deliver today the anniversary oration at the institution’s 75th anniversary celebrations, to be held at the Atrium of the institution.

title: TPA, ITAK discuss economic, political issues with US Congressional staff
byline: The Tamil  Progressive Alliance (TPA) and the Illangai Tamil Arasu Kachchi (ITAK) discussed economic and political reforms with the US Congressional staff in Colombo, TPA leader Mano Ganesan said today.

title: Gazette soon to make seat belts mandatory for Expressway buses: Minister
byline: A gazette notification containing regulations that make it mandatory for passengers travelling in passenger buses on expressways to wear seat belts is scheduled to be issued on August 31, Transport, Highways, Ports and Civil Aviation Minister Bimal Rathnayake said.

title: Nimal Lanza remanded
byline: Former Parliamentarian Nimal Lanza was remanded until September 12 after being produced before the Negombo Magistrate’s Court today.

title: Ranil discharged
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe has been discharged from hospital this afternoon, former President’s office said.

title: Thai court removes Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office
byline: Thailand’s Constitutional Court has removed suspended Prime Minister Paetongtarn Shinawatra from office, after finding her guilty of ethical misconduct over a controversial phone call with Cambodia’s former leader, Hun Sen.

title: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa further remanded
byline: Former Minister Shashindra Rajapaksa was today ordered to be further remanded till September 12 by Colombo Chief Magistrate Asanga S. Bodaragama after being arrested on charges of corruption and conspiracy.

title: Crude oil prices fall to $68.24, set for weekly gain despite demand concerns
byline: Oil prices declined on Friday, though they remain on track to register a weekly gain. The market is navigating opposing forces. On one hand, demand is expected to soften with the approach of the end of the U.S. summer driving season, a period when fuel consumption typically peaks in the world’s largest oil consumer. On the other hand, traders continue to weigh the uncertainty surrounding the stability and availability of Russian supply.

title: New Rs. 2000 commemorative banknote presented to President
byline: A new Rs. 2000 commemorative banknote marking the 75th anniversary of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) was presented to President Anura Kumara Dissanayake today.

title: Rathana Thera remanded
byline: Former MP Athuraliye Rathana Thera was remanded till September 12 by the Gangodawila Magistrate today.

title: When the iron is hot, hit it: Ex-Envoy Kananathan
byline: The United States has dealt a heavy blow to South Asian trade by slapping 50% tariffs on most imports from India, a move expected to hit New Delhi’s $86 billion annual exports to the U.S. hard. President Donald Trump said the decision is aimed at cutting India’s access to the U.S. market while pressuring it over continued purchases of Russian oil.

title: Ranil transferred to normal ward
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe, who was receiving treatment at the Intensive Care Unit (ICU) of the National Hospital, Colombo, has been transferred to a normal ward, UNP Assistant Leader Akila Viraj Kariyawasam told the media.

title: Wharf clerk arrested for soliciting bribe
byline: A wharf clerk of a private firm registered with the Customs Department has been arrested for soliciting a bribe for releasing a container.
